intro: Dimeria bialata, commonly known as the Bialata dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dimeria bialata is considered a species of conservation concern.
